meanings.definition: To revoke or cancel a gift or bequest.
meanings.sent1: She adeemed the present she had given to her friend.
meanings.sent2: The court adeemed the inheritance due to legal issues.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly adeemed the cookies he had shared with his brother.
meanings.sent4: The storm adeemed all hopes of a sunny day.
meanings.sent5: The teacher adeemed the incorrect answers from the student's test.

meanings.definition: To be deprived of something previously given or bequeathed.
meanings.sent1: The toy was adeemed from the child by his older sibling.
meanings.sent2: She felt adeemed of her happiness after the loss.
meanings.sent3: The cat adeemed the warm spot on the couch from the dog.
meanings.sent4: The thief adeemed the precious jewel from the museum.
meanings.sent5: The plant was adeemed of sunlight in the shadowy corner.
